ygData.subject: Re:  Twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Be very very careful if you re doing this to help newbies. Newbies tend to be in zones with guards and NPC merchants. I ve been killed a grand total of one
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 15 Jul 1999 silky@... wrote:
>
> Most folks realize you aren't doing nearly enough damage with bellow to be
> ABLE to KS - and if it's a multiple mob, and they are paying attention at
> all, they will kiss your feet for lullaby. If it's really low level - I'll
> even tick them off, get them to turn their attention towards ME, take the
> heat and just stand there and not swing, let the person get some backhits
> and heal or at least stop getting hurt.

Be very very careful if you're doing this to help newbies.
Newbies tend to be in zones with guards and NPC merchants.
I've been killed a grand total of one time using Lullaby in a
dungeon setting. I've been killed twice playing Lullaby to
help newbies. First time was at the bandit camp in GFay, and
a wandering guard whacked me from behind. The second time was
in Butcherblock. I positioned myself so that a merchant was
well out of the range I'd figured for Discord via
experimentation, and hit Lullaby. Either my estimate was
wrong or Lullaby's range is bigger than Discord.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
